EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.73}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Ratings on the y-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Tennis on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Tennis on the x-axis is {0.70}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Gaming and Fan Engagement or the cell corresponding to Streaming and Merchandise?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Streaming} and {Merchandise} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Media Rights and Fan Engagement or the cell corresponding to Media Rights and Merchandise?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Media Rights} and {Merchandise} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Media Rights and Attendance or the cell corresponding to Tennis and Viewership?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Tennis} and {Viewership} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Streaming and Fan Engagement or the cell corresponding to Publishing and Revenue?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Streaming} and {Fan Engagement} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.16 to 0.24?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Basketball, Attendance), (Events, Attendance), (Gaming, Attendance), (Basketball, Fan Engagement), (Events, Fan Engagement), (Basketball, Merchandise), (Events, Ratings), (Basketball, Revenue), (Events, Revenue), (Gaming, Revenue), (Basketball, Social Media), (Gaming, Social Media), (Basketball, Streaming Hours), (Events, Streaming Hours), (Basketball, Ticket Sales), (Events, Ticket Sales), (Basketball, Viewership), (Events, Viewership)}.
